issue.title: [CI] Upgrade Fedora 33 to Fedora 35
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14927](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14927). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Fedora 33 has reached End Of Life. Upgrade to Fedora 35 or possibly Fedora Rawhide. A new edition of Fedora is released every 6 months.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14927?focusedCommentId=17504752) by Benson Muite (baksmj):*
There are a number of official images https://hub.docker.com/_/fedora/ current stable version is 35, pre-release version is rawhide. For this ticket will use 35, though using latest would make maintenance easier.  It may also be worth adding a rawhide build, rawhide is similar to Debian testing.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14927?focusedCommentId=17505287) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
Issue resolved by pull request 12607
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12607>
